  "description": "Eco Fleet Services -&nbsp;We are a forward-thinking Nigerian transport and logistics company committed to providing sustainable, reliable, and efficient mobility solutions. Our focus is on fleet management, haulage, and CNG-powered transport services, helping clients cut costs while embracing cleaner energy alternatives.

With expertise in driver management, vehicle maintenance, road safety, and eco-friendly logistics, we ensure smooth and safe movement of goods and people across Nigeria. Guided by innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction, we are shaping the future of green transport solutions in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer (Fleet &amp; Transport Operations)

Job Locations:&nbsp;Abeokuta - Ogun, Osogbo - Osun and Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Logistics Officer will coordinate the day-to-day transport activities, monitor vehicle movements, optimize routes, and ensure timely delivery.
	The role requires strong planning skills, knowledge of transport/logistics processes, and the ability to work under pressure.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, schedule, and oversee daily fleet movements and transport assignments.
	Ensure efficient use of trucks and drivers to minimize cost and downtime.
	Monitor CNG trucks and vehicles in real-time, ensuring compliance with route plans.
	Track deliveries and report on turnaround times, delays, or incidents.
	Coordinate with workshop and service teams to align transport schedules with maintenance needs.
	Maintain records of trips, fuel usage, driver performance, and service history.
	Liaise with contractors, vendors, and internal teams for smooth logistics operations.
	Assist in route planning to optimize fuel consumption and ensure timely deliveries.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, HSE regulations, and transport laws.
	Prepare and submit periodic logistics and fleet performance reports.


Qualifications &amp; Requirements


	B.Sc. in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related discipline.
	3&ndash;5 years of experience in logistics, transport coordination, or fleet operations.
	Knowledge of CNG-powered trucks or alternative fuel fleets is an advantage.
	Strong organizational and time management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and logistics/fleet management systems.
	Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.


What We Offer


	Salary: N200,000 - N250,000 / month.
	Competitive salary and welfare package.
	Exposure to modern fleet operations and sustainable transport systems.
	Professional training and career development opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to:&nbsp;hr.ecofleetservices@yahoo.com&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

Logistics Officer (Fleet & Transport Operations) Job at Eco Fleet Services




        
    

        
        Eco Fleet Services - We are a forward-thinking Nigerian transport and logistics company committed to providing sustainable, reliable, and efficient mobility solutions. Our focus is on fleet management, haulage, and CNG-powered transport services, helping clients cut costs while embracing cleaner energy alternatives.

With expertise in driver management, vehicle maintenance, road safety, and eco-friendly logistics, we ensure smooth and safe movement of goods and people across Nigeria. Guided by innovation, sustainability, and customer satisfaction, we are shaping the future of green transport solutions in Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Logistics Officer (Fleet & Transport Operations)
     

            
    



Job Locations: Abeokuta - Ogun, Osogbo - Osun and Ibadan - Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	The Logistics Officer will coordinate the day-to-day transport activities, monitor vehicle movements, optimize routes, and ensure timely delivery.
	The role requires strong planning skills, knowledge of transport/logistics processes, and the ability to work under pressure.


Key Responsibilities


	Plan, schedule, and oversee daily fleet movements and transport assignments.
	Ensure efficient use of trucks and drivers to minimize cost and downtime.
	Monitor CNG trucks and vehicles in real-time, ensuring compliance with route plans.
	Track deliveries and report on turnaround times, delays, or incidents.
	Coordinate with workshop and service teams to align transport schedules with maintenance needs.
	Maintain records of trips, fuel usage, driver performance, and service history.
	Liaise with contractors, vendors, and internal teams for smooth logistics operations.
	Assist in route planning to optimize fuel consumption and ensure timely deliveries.
	Ensure compliance with company policies, HSE regulations, and transport laws.
	Prepare and submit periodic logistics and fleet performance reports.


Qualifications & Requirements


	B.Sc. in Logistics, Supply Chain Management, Business Administration, or related discipline.
	3–5 years of experience in logistics, transport coordination, or fleet operations.
	Knowledge of CNG-powered trucks or alternative fuel fleets is an advantage.
	Strong organizational and time management skills.
	Proficiency in MS Office and logistics/fleet management systems.
	Excellent problem-solving and communication skills.


What We Offer


	Salary: N200,000 - N250,000 / month.
	Competitive salary and welfare package.
	Exposure to modern fleet operations and sustainable transport systems.
	Professional training and career development opportunities.


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: hr.ecofleetservices@yahoo.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Auldon Limited
content:
Auldon Limited is a toy trading company strategically located in the commercial centre of idumota Lagos Nigeria, it is a wholesale distribution organization servicing major departmental stores, Multi-National Organizations and educational institutions within Nigeria and its sub-region. Founded as Arigold Toys in 1996 before transforming into a limited liability company, with the registration RC-439491 and named auldon limited in the year 2002. Auldon was featured on Forbes as the biggest toy trading company in Nigeria with a valuation of over $10 million

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Sales and Marketing Manager
     

            
    



Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description


	Auldon Limited is currently recruiting for a Sales & Marketing Manager who willoversee the daily operation of the company Sales & Marketing Team.
	Sales andMarketing Manager will be responsible for developing, implementing, and managingthe overall sales and marketing strategies of the organization.
	This person must be able to identify target customers, develop a voice and image for the business,select marketing tools and setting long and short-term goals for their teams.
	Sales and marketing managers may also work closely with company leaders to aligntheir strategies with corporate goals and values.


Key Responsibilities


	Implementing new sales plans and advertising.
	Researching and developing marketing opportunities and plans, understanding consumer requirements, identifying market trends, and suggesting system improvements to achieve the company's marketing goals.
	Analyzing budgets, preparing annual budget plans, scheduling expenditures, and ensuring that the sales team meets their quotas and goals.
	Maintaining relationships with important clients by making regular visits, understanding their needs, and anticipating new marketing opportunities.
	Promoting the company's existing brands and introducing new products to the market.
	Gathering, investigating, and summarizing market data and trends to draft reports.


Requirements


	A Bachelor's Degree in Marketing, Business Administration, or related field.
	6 - 8 years of experience in marketing or sales.
	Experience in management may be advantageous.
	Excellent communication, interpersonal, and customer service skills.
	Knowledge of data analysis and report writing.


Salary
N700,000 - N8,000,000 monthly.

Application Closing Date: 22nd September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Operations@auldontoys.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Chartered Accountant

Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	We are currently recruiting for a Financial Manager that will analyze everyday financial activities and subsequently provide advice and guidance to upper management on future financial plans.
	The goal is to enable the company’s leaders to make sound business decisions and meet the company’s objectives. In this role, you will have the opportunity to utilize your expertise in financial analysis and strategic planning.
	By analyzing day-to-day financial activities with precision, you will provide valuable insights and recommendations to upper management.
	Your guidance will empower the company’s leaders to make informed decisions that align with the organization’s long-term goals.


Key Responsibilities


	Analyze daily sales reports and financial statements for trends and discrepancies.
	Prepare and present financial performance reports to senior management
	Oversee operations of the finance department, set goals and objectives, and design a framework for these to be met.
	Ensuring all finance and accounting operations comply with generally accepted accounting principles and federal and state laws and regulations.
	Ensuring day-to-day transactions such as accounts payable, cash receipts and accounts receivable, credit card transactions, and payroll are recorded
	properly.
	Performing fiscal year-end close activities and assisting with activities and requirements of external auditors.
	Review and approve expenditure requests within designated limits.
	Oversee reconciliation of general ledger accounts and bank statements.


Required Skills


	Bachelor’s degree in Finance, Accounting, Business Administration, or a related field.
	Minimum of 5 years of experience in a finance or accounting role, with at least 2 years in a managerial position.
	Proven experience in retail finance or a similar industry.
	Strong knowledge of financial reporting, budgeting, and forecasting.
	Experience in cash flow management and financial modeling.
	Familiarity with accounting software and enterprise resource planning (ERP) systems.
	Ability to prepare and present comprehensive financial reports to senior management.
	Strong understanding of inventory management and cost-reduction strategies.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office Suite, especially Excel.
	Experience in preparing monthly, quarterly, and annual financial statements.
	Familiarity with tax filing requirements and coordination with tax advisors
	Certified Accountant (CPA), Chartered Financial Analyst (CFA), or ICAN is a plus.


Salary
N300,000 - N400,000 per month.

Application Closing Date: 12th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Operations@auldontoys.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Inventory Officer

Job Location: Idumota, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Description


	Auldon Limited is currently recruiting for an Inventory Officer who will be responsible for managing inventory levels, coordinating the movement of goods, and ensuring efficient logistics operations in the Organization.
	This role involves overseeing inventory control, coordinating shipments, and optimizing the supply chain to meet client demands and minimize costs.
	The Inventory and Logistics Coordinator works closely with various departments to ensure timely and
	accurate delivery of goods.
	The Inventory and Logistics Manager supports efforts and oversees record keeping and reporting requirements.
	Your attention to detail, organizational skills, and ability to work under pressure will be essential in this role.


Key Responsibilities


	Monitor inventory levels and ensure accuracy through regular stock counts.
	Coordinate with various departments to forecast demand and maintain optimal inventory levels.
	Implement inventory control measures to minimize stockouts and overstock situations.
	Provide accurate and up-to-date digital and physical inventory records for regular reporting purposes.
	Plan and schedule the transportation of goods from warehouse to the final destination.
	Move equipment and goods between facilities as needed to meet business requirements.
	Collaborate with internal teams to optimize logistics processes and improve efficiency.
	Collect, analyze, and interpret data related to inventory levels, logistics performance, and supply chain metrics.
	Utilize inventory management software and other tools to track inventory and logistics activities.


Required Skills


	Bachelor's Degree in Supply Chain Management, Logistics, Business Administration, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
	2 - 4 years of relevant work experience in Proven experience in inventory management, logistics coordination, or a similar role.
	Proficient in using inventory management software and other relevant tools.
	Excellent communication and interpersonal skills to collaborate with internal teams, suppliers, and customers.
	Strong multitasking skills to manage multiple projects simultaneously.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Application Closing Date: 10th September, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: Operations@auldontoys.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.
